availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Lewis Veatch (Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer and slaveholder.)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer and slaveholder. Kentucky, native. Son of Thomas Veatch and Jane Stewart Huff Veatch. Farmer in Harrison County, Kentucky, in 1850. Employed Joseph Moffit in Harrison County in 1850. Owned eleven enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1850. Farmer in Harrison County in 1860. Owned thirteen enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 1, p. 72B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 1, p. 376.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 151.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 128B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, Cynthiana, p. 156B.
"Lewis Veatch (1804-1891)," Find A Grave, Memorial #88505693, accessed April 14, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/88505693.
